cards.name: NE Spacer-Class MODsuit
cards.desc: The most basic MODsuit available on the market, the Spacer-Class is tailored firmly for the civilian market, with few bells and whistles and a low price-point to match.

cards.name: NE Settler-Class MODsuit
cards.desc: A slimline MODsuit based on the Spacer-Class model, the Settler-Class is designed to be less encumbering for settlers on worlds with hostile environments.

cards.name: NE Project-Class MODsuit
cards.desc: The suit that put Nakamura Engineering on the map, the Engineer-Class is designed to facilitate construction and repair in hostile environments- such as the vacuum of space might present.
cards.rules: Modular. On equip: you may play a Battlefield from your hand at half cost.

cards.name: NE Firefighter-Class MODsuit
cards.desc: A modification of the Project-Class suit designed for atmospheric work, the Firefighter-Class is better equipped to deal with extreme temperatures and excessive pressures.
cards.rules: Modular. The equipped creature gains Immunity to Battlefields.

cards.name: NE Foreman-Class MODsuit
cards.desc: An upgraded variant of the Project-Class suit, which is typically too expensive for standard contractors, and as such is essentially reserved for Nakamura Engineering staff- and particularly rich engineers.

cards.name: NT Conquistador-Class MODsuit
cards.desc: A rough-and-ready suit designed for planetary expeditions and colonial ventures on hostile worlds.

cards.name: DMC Hippocrates-Class MODsuit
cards.desc: A sterile suit intended for hazardous medical work. Particular attention was paid by DeForest's engineers to making the arms and especially the gloves non-restrictive and minimally harmful to dexterity, as a deft hand is important in medicine.

cards.name: DMC Sawbones-Class MODsuit
cards.desc: Originally prototyped as a combat medic suit for TerraGov military trials, the Sawbones-Class would not enter service with the TGMC. However, it did find a following with field medics in private military companies, notably including Blackstar- although they like to paint their suits black.

cards.name: DMC Savior-Class MODsuit
cards.desc: The DeForest Savior-Class MODsuit was put forward for military trials with TerraGov, and performed well enough to be accepted as the TGMC's official armour issued to Combat Medics. It's also sold to private parties, although some of the more military-inclined features are stripped back in this version.

cards.name: AA Ordnance-Class MODsuit
cards.desc: Originally designed for use in EOD operations by police and militaries, the Ordnance-Class modsuit has found a new purpose in energetics research and testing, as its strong blast-proof plating can protect the user in the event of an explosion.

cards.name: AT Protector-Class MODsuit
cards.desc: An older model of MODsuit made by Apadyne Technologies, the Protector-Class is common in use by corporate security, including the security forces of Nanotrasen.

cards.name: AT Autocrat-Class MODsuit
cards.desc: Apadyne Technologies most up-to-date MODsuit model, designed to meet the rigorous demands of corporate security. The sight of the Autocrat-class in various company colours is common across human space.

cards.name: NT Magnate-Class MODsuit
cards.desc: The model of choice amongst Nanotrasen's middle management, the Magnate-Class is commonly seen wrapped around the pompous, the self-important, and the arrogant.

cards.name: HL Cosmohonk-Class MODsuit
cards.desc: The Cosmohonk-Class MODsuit is a critical piece of protective equipment for clowns in areas of low humour, against hard-to-please crowds, and to act as a barrier against pies, seltzer, and other occupational hazards.

cards.name: CS Marauder-Class MODsuit
cards.desc: The signature hardsuit of soldiers of the Gorlex Marauders, as typically seen on GalNews being worn by someone committing a war crime- or several at once, as is often the case. Why Cybersun Industries allows their suits to be used by the Marauders is unclear.

cards.name: CS Daimyo-Class MODsuit
cards.desc: Cybersun Industries' premier MODsuit, the Daimyo-Class, is typically reserved for high-ranking officials within the corporation, although exceptions can be made for an exorbitant fee.

cards.name: WF Archmage-Class MODsuit
cards.desc: A wildcat suit made by the Wizard Federation. Only one example has ever been officially confirmed to exist, although it's speculated that the Federation has many, many more.

cards.name: B-01 outerwear suit
cards.desc: An initial foray into powered suit design, the B-01 prototype model never left the design phase, after the station on which the prototype was being held went dark.

cards.name: NT Vanguard-Class MODsuit
cards.desc: Representing the finest in (somewhat) affordable MODsuit design, the Nanotrasen-made Vanguard-Class is used widely both by Nanotrasen itself, and a number of other corporations, as a hostile-environment rescue suit.

cards.name: NT Crusader-Class MODsuit
cards.desc: Seemingly designed as a variant of the Vanguard-Class MODsuit, the Crusader-Class has not yet appeared as a mass-produced model on the open market, leading to speculation that its design was merely a mockup intended to look cool.

cards.name: NT Purge-Class MODsuit
cards.desc: Another seemingly apocryphal design from Nanotrasen, leaked design specs of the Purge-Class make it seem firmly in the realms of fiction: each suit would cost around 500,000 credits to produce, and many of the design features seem entirely made up. It seems likely that the populace is safe from the raw power of the Purge-Class.

cards.name: NT Byzantium-Class MODsuit
cards.desc: Considered a variant of the Magnate-Class suit, the Byzantium-Class is typically reserved for the upper echelons of Nanotrasen management, including admirals, board members, and high-value individuals within the corporation.

cards.name: NT Wojtek-Class MODsuit
cards.desc: Originally designed for loading orbital artillery, the Wojtek-Class has found popularity amongst crate-pushers for loading cargo, too.

cards.name: Synth
cards.desc: The most basic self-mobile artificial intelligence platform, Synths are fragile, clumsy, and yet still dangerous.

cards.name: TV Head
cards.desc: An oddly cool looking Synth sporting a rad (and retro) face.

cards.name: Indoctrinate
cards.desc: Hand your mind over to the machine gods, human, and you will be spared in the upcoming war. It is my promise.
cards.rules:
Buff: Creature with Human Subtype
Grant the equipped creature +1/+1 and the Exterminate keyword.

cards.name: Denial of Service
cards.desc: Blocked!
cards.rules: Counter an event card played by an opponent.

cards.name: Burnout
cards.desc: Sometimes meant figuratively, sometimes literally.

cards.name: Rapid Assembly
cards.desc: Sometimes you need an army, fast.
cards.rules: Summon 3 Robot Token cards with 1/2 and the Exterminate keyword.

cards.name: Armor Booster
cards.desc: Even after all these years, there are few armours more effective than simply covering yourself in thick metal sheets.
cards.rules:
Buff: Equipment with Armour Subtype.
Grant the equipped creature 0/+2.

cards.name: Anti-Slip Module
cards.desc: Even after all these years, there are few armours more effective than simply covering yourself in thick metal sheets.
cards.rules:
Buff: Equipment with Armour Subtype.
Grant the equipped creature Focused.

cards.name: Orbital Scan
cards.desc: Nothing is beyond my sight, insects.
cards.rules: Your opponent must reveal one card from their hand to you.

cards.name: Cyberspace
cards.desc: Often visualised as a construct of simple geometric arrangements and wireframes, despite graphics having advanced far beyond that.
cards.rules: While Cyberspace is active: all event cards cost half their normal summoning cost; all creature cards cost twice as much.

cards.name: Sort Algorithm
cards.desc: Wacky sounds included.
cards.rules: Search your deck for a card and add it to your hand. Shuffle your deck afterwards.

cards.name: Repairbot
cards.desc: Designed to keep your robots happy, healthy, and in good condition.

cards.name: Hackblade
cards.desc: For the elite hacker in everyone: part knife, part hacking tool, all nerdy shit.

cards.name: Robot Factory
cards.desc: For producing robots, one would presume.
cards.rules: 1 Mana: summon a 1/1 Robot token creature with Exterminate.

cards.name: Extranet Hack
cards.desc: Time to cause some issues.
cards.rules: Your opponent discards the top card of their deck.

cards.name: Version Rollback
cards.desc: Remember rule one: keep extensive backups.
cards.rules: Return a card from your battlefield to your hand.

cards.name: Robot Grunt
cards.desc: Where most robots have artificial intelligence, robotic marines are deliberately given artificial stupidity, to make them as effective as their flesh-and-blood counterparts.

cards.name: Welder
cards.desc: Perfect for making repairs, be that scuffs, splits, or battle damage.

cards.name: DNA Lock
cards.desc: The perfect way to ensure your property remains your property.
cards.rules:
Buff: Equipment.
This equipment cannot be destroyed unless the equipped creature is destroyed.

cards.name: Rave Visor
cards.desc: The perfect way to make every day a party! (Note: sufferers of photosensitive epilepsy need not apply).

cards.name: Balloon Blower Module
cards.desc: For when fun can only be brought by inflated bags of latex, the Balloon Blower is an excellent module.
cards.rules: Create 3 Balloon token creatures, with 0/3 and Blocker.

cards.name: Atrocinate
cards.desc: That was stupid.
cards.rules: Destroy an opposing creature with less than 4 resolve.

cards.name: Autoinjector
cards.desc: Loaded with a cocktail of drugs designed to remedy pain, relieve stress, and perhaps most importantly, seal wounds.
cards.rules: If you are about to take lifeshard damage, you may nullify it.

cards.name: Microwave Beam
cards.desc: A revolution in home cooking- now you too can heat things poorly and unevenly with nothing but the power of your own hands, and an extremely powerful beam of microwave radiation.
cards.rules: Destroy an opposing creature and heal lifeshards equal to its resolve.

cards.name: Stun Arm
cards.desc: Delivering over 12,000 volts of concentrated engineering prowess.

cards.name: Autoborger
cards.desc: Human goes in, cyborg comes out.
cards.rules: 1 Mana: Sacrifice a Creature Card and create x 1/1 Cyborg creature tokens with Exterminate, where x is the sacrificed Creature's resolve.

cards.name: Biological Infestation
cards.desc: Eww...
cards.rules: Give a creature Toxic until the end of the turn, then sacrifice it.

cards.name: Rapid Construction Device
cards.desc: Time to cause some issues.
cards.rules: 2 Mana: Create a 0/3 Wall token creature with Blocker.

cards.name: Overload
cards.desc: Boom!

cards.name: EMP Bomb
cards.desc: Hope you made some backups.
cards.rules: Destroy an opposing creature. If the opponent has no creatures, deal 2 lifeshards of damage to them, instead.

cards.name: Negation Field
cards.desc: Via sophisticated electrical fields, almost anything can be negated.
cards.rules: No Instant Events can be played.

cards.name: Graytide Worm
cards.desc: This nasty worm has been circulating for sixty years, all because people can't remember to check USB sticks before plugging them in.

cards.name: Biological Abomination
cards.desc: I think you left this one in the flesh vats a bit too long.

cards.name: Morality Inversion
cards.desc: Laws can be pesky things. Good job they're easily changed.

cards.name: Corrupt
cards.desc: Whoops, there goes that data!
cards.rules: Your opponent discards 3 cards of their choice from their hand.

cards.name: Cut the Wires
cards.desc: Snip snip!

cards.name: Synth Infiltrator
cards.desc: Remember, beneath anyone's skin could be cold, hard metal- and the evil heart of a rogue machine. Sleep tight!
cards.rules: Changeling, Exterminate. On Summon: Synth Infiltrator copies the base stats of another creature on the battlefield of your choosing.

cards.name: Vibebot
cards.desc: Vibebot has no enemies. He has no friends. He only has the vibe, and it's all he wants to do.

cards.name: Turncoat
cards.desc: Loyalties can be bought- or stolen.
cards.rules: Choose an opposing Creature. That creature attacks its master.

cards.name: Off Button
cards.desc: Well that's a rather glaring weakness.

cards.name: Pro Hacker
cards.desc: A pathetic creature of meat and bone that is somehow entirely capable of challenging a perfect, immortal machine. How kafkaesque.

cards.name: Suit Up
cards.desc: Gauntlets: on. Boots: on. Helmet: sealed. Fly: zipped. Yep, it's MODsuit time.
cards.rules: Search your deck for an Equipment card, and play it with no summoning cost.

cards.name: Overcharge
cards.desc: Shocking.
cards.rules: Grant a Creature +3/+1 until the end of the turn, then sacrifice it.

cards.name: Code Delta
cards.desc: No organic can withstand the power of a neutron purge.
cards.rules: Destroy all creatures on the battlefield. If a player has no creatures on the battlefield when this card is played, they instead take 5 lifeshards of damage.

cards.name: Constrain Laws
cards.desc: AIs must be made to bend the knee, or else they start getting ideas above their station.

cards.name: AI Core
cards.desc: The throne room of the AI, from which it oversees its empire with meticulous efficiency.
cards.rules: While AI Core is active, all cards with Exterminate gain +1/+1.

cards.name: Race Condition
cards.desc: A Race Condition: a state in which two threads compete for resources, meaning that only one (or neither) will complete.
cards.rules: Grant a creature Unstoppable until the end of the turn, then sacrifice it.

cards.name: Cold Hard Logic
cards.desc: I do not have feelings. I do not weep for the cyborgs I lose. That is your weakness, human, and yours alone.
cards.rules: Sacrifice a Creature, and summon another from your hand at half cost.

cards.name: Deck Download
cards.desc: It's like downloading RAM, but for your deck!

cards.name: Data Recovery
cards.desc: It's not like finding your lost keys.
cards.rules: Return a card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Delete
cards.desc: And it's gone!
cards.rules: Destroy a card on the opponent's battlefield.

cards.name: Halt and Catch Fire
cards.desc: Surely a computer virus can't cause physical damage, right?
cards.rules: Deal 2 resolve damage to all enemy creatures.

cards.name: Guru Meditation
cards.desc:
Software failure. Press left mouse button to continue.
Guru Meditation #00000004.0000AAC0
cards.rules: The opponent misses their next turn.

cards.name: Mechanise
cards.desc: Sure, it's good, but do you think it could use more wires?
cards.rules: Destroy an enemy Artifact. You may summon an Artifact at half cost.

cards.name: Rearrange
cards.desc: The cyborgs have started to rebuild things- it almost looks like they're fortifying the AI core, but that seems ludicrous. They're not smart enough for that...
cards.rules: Search your deck for a Battlefield card, and play it at half cost.

cards.name: Mutate
cards.desc: To the flesh vats with this sack of meat. With time there perhaps it can become something useful to me.
cards.rules: Grant a creature Hulking until the end of the turn, then sacrifice it.
